description: From Ancient Greek ἀνά (aná, “against”) and τόπος (tópos, “place”); apparently by analogy with anachronism.

entries.meaning: (rare) A thing that is out of its proper place; the geographic counterpart to anachronism.
examples: A war elephant described rampaging through Tenochtitlan in a novel about the Aztec Empire would be an anatopism.
